Posts.Content: She has breast cancer. Got it 11 years ago. Had mastectomy etal. Now it's mestasticized to her breastbone. They wanted to give her some IV chemical (don't know the name) drug to stop the bone itself from thinning any more than it already is. Two days after her first IV, she got an infection in her foot. Size of a football. Is this a common occurrence from such a toxic chemical? Anyone heard of such a thing?
Posts.Title: My sister in law and her cancer

Posts.Content: " As I'm dressing, she says, " listen, I shouldn't be saying this but I did see something on your sonno and I really think you should ask your doc for a biopsy"....And I leave. " This is totally uncalled for. The tech is never suppose to discuss what she THINKS she sees. Only your doctor should be discussing the results with you, after the Radiologist looks at your mamo and writes a report. You should continue to find another specialist and get his opinion. And go from there.
Posts.Title: PLEASE I could really use some feedback

Posts.Content: Well in that case it was a blessing. But in my case, she put me thru hell needlessly. Once the thought of my having something abnormal growing in my breast, I could no longer function (I'm on antidepressants anyhow). And then it took over a month to finally get to see the Breast Doctor.
Posts.Title: PLEASE I could really use some feedback

Posts.Content: A member of my family has breast cancer and had one recurrence already. This began 5-6 years ago. She tells me she's feeling very tired. She went and had a PET Scan. They could not find anything. :P Does this mean without a doubt, she does not have cancers elsewhere in her body? Educate me.
Posts.Title: PET Scans

Posts.Content: Congratulations. Glad to hear the good news!
Posts.Title: TEST RESULTS!
